reviews.review: You shoot a hole in one wall, and a hole in the other, and they're connected. If you walk through one you come out the other. Oh and there's cake.

Valve, Valve Coperation. 2011 Dec 27.

When I first heard about this game I thought it would be like any other puzzle game; it would start with a few fun levels then quickly descend into frustrating torture but how wrong was I? This game is amazing! The game has been very well play tested and the difficulty curve is perfect so the puzzles remain at just the right level to be challenging and satisfying. Like most other Valve games it is very well polished with great attention to detail. Despite it being a puzzle game it has a great plot and probably the best gaming antagonist. Stop procrastinating and get this game now.

Neat!

Portal is a game that changed the puzzle industry.  Breaking the mold of norm of switches and pegs, portal gives you a single piece of hardware with which limits do not exist.  A single arm attachment let's you defy gravity, reach terminal velocity speeds, and even hurl yourself across chasms, by bending the forces of physics to your will.  

Chasm in your way that no mortal man could jump across?  Speed yourself up to breakneck fall speeds, then through a clever use of mechanics, change your falling trajectory to a lateral motion, and off you go sailing across the landscape.  Need to reach a high platform?  Place portal-a above it, and portal-b on the floor in front of you.  Suddenly you can 'fall up' to where you need to be.

Physics and spatial reasoning be damned!  Portal defies logic, and forces you to think creatively.
Short but great game.

How can you have not played this yet? Yes, it's short, but it not only turns the FPS on its head, it has a one of the best villians ever. And, there is cake, or so I have been told.
Do you like puzzles? Do you like being confused? Do you like being condescended to? Do you like developing warm fuzzy feelings for inanimate objects? Well then this game is for you :D
